newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-DORTMUND RETURN TO ACTION WITH 3-1 VICTORY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-DORTMUND RETURN TO ACTION WITH 3-1 VICTORY.

text.p: Champions Borussia Dortmund began the second half of the German league season with an impressive 3-1 victory over title rivals Bayer Leverkusen to go top of the Bundesliga on Friday.

In the first day of action since the league's two-month winter break, Dortmund came from behind to clinch victory with two goals from Euro 96 midfielder Andy Moeller and a strike from Swiss Stephane Chapuisat.
Dortmund are a point ahead of Bayern Munich who play hosts to St. Pauli on Saturday.
In the night's other match Cologne beat struggling Fortuna Duesseldorf 2-0.
